replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: Drop in a Morimoto 3" STi-r glass lens on the projector. The OEM ones are plastic. Remove the plastic OEM, cut off the 3 little alignment nubs. The new glass one does not need to be glued back on as the chrome housing will secure the lens in place very well with no glue or brackets needed. Result is a blue cut-off and improved clarity. Worth the extra $60.00 bucks for the lens. I did mine when i smoked out the Cress and amber side reflector.
topLevelComment.author: @redlinemsa

replies.text: Yep I did mine too when I ripped out all the lightingtrends crap and switched over to Glowe. I'm offering the lens upgrade as an add-on to the etched lens service on my site, I'm just out of stock on the lenses: https://squarewheelsauto.com/collections/aftermarket-lighting/products/etched-lenses?variant=43153294917840
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: They look awesome. Reason you can't use one controller for the demon eyes and the halos is because the halos are individually adressable and have a controller inside of each led on the halo. They are also controlled with just 3 wires where as the demon eyes do not have any controllers on board the led so they need one main controller to control them and they use 4 wires usually unless there is a dedicated white led which will be 5 wires. It would be possible to make a controller that can do both but it would be costly and complicated
topLevelComment.author: @deaedfly

replies.text: Thanks for this intel man!!!! I saw the 3 vs 5 wires difference but didn't realize the addressable LEDs had controllers on board. Another mystery solvedü§ôüèΩü§ôüèΩü§ôüèΩ
